summary: TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2008 PONTIAC VIBE. THE CONTACT RECEIVED NOTIFICATION OF NHTSA CAMPAIGN NUMBER: 19V627000 (AIR BAGS) HOWEVER, THE PART TO DO THE RECALL REPAIR WAS UNAVAILABLE. THE CONTACT STATED THAT HER AIR BAG WARNING LIGHT WAS ILLUMINATED ON THE INSTRUMENT PANEL. THE CONTACT TOOK THE VEHICLE TO WUERFLEIN CHEVROLET BUICK GMC (2527 BRIDGE AVE, ALBERT LEA, MN 56007) TO BE REPAIRED UNDER THE RECALL. UPON RETURN OF THE VEHICLE, THE CONTACT DISCOVERED THAT THE AIR BAG WARNING LIGHT REMAINED ILLUMINATED DESPITE THE REPAIR. THE CONTACT CALLED THE SAME DEALER BACK AND WAS INFORMED SHE HAD TO PAY A DIAGNOSTIC FEE TO HAVE THE VEHICLE DIAGNOSED. THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOTIFIED OF THE FAILURE AND THE CONTACT WAS PROVIDED A CASE NUMBER. THE VEHICLE WAS NOT REPAIRED. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS UNKNOWN.  *BF  *TR

TL* TAKATA RECALL. THE CONTACT OWNS A 2008 PONTIAC VIBE. THE CONTACT RECEIVED NOTIFICATION OF NHTSA CAMPAIGN NUMBER: 19V627000 (AIR BAGS) HOWEVER, THE PART TO DO THE RECALL REPAIR WAS NOT YET AVAILABLE. HONOLULU BUICK GMC LOCATED AT 2945 N NIMITZ HWY, HONOLULU, HI 96819, WAS CONTACTED AND IT WAS CONFIRMED THAT THE PART WAS NOT YET AVAILABLE. THE CONTACT STATED THAT THE MANUFACTURER EXCEEDED A REASONABLE AMOUNT OF TIME FOR THE RECALL REPAIR.  THE MANUFACTURER WAS MADE AWARE OF THE ISSUE. THE CONTACT HAD NOT EXPERIENCED A FAILURE. VIN TOOL CONFIRMS PARTS NOT AVAILABLE. *BF  *JS

I RECEIVED A SAFETY RECALL LETTER FROM PONTIAC IN MILWAUKEE, WISCONSIN DATED OCTOBER 2019 STATING THAT THE FRONT PASSENGER AIR BAG ASSEMBLY CONTAINING AN INFLATOR IS DEFECTIVE. THE AIR BAG MAY NOT UNFOLD AS DESIGNED DURING INFLATION DURING HIGH TEMPERATURE CONDITIONS .WHAT COULD HAPPEN IS THAT A PORTION OF THE AIR BAG MATERIAL COULD BE TORN DURING DEPLOYMENT, OR THE BAG PLATE COULD BE DAMAGED. SUCH DAMAGE DURING DEPLOYMENT COULD CAUSE THE AIR BAG NOT TO PROPERLY INFLATE, AND THIS COULD INCREASE THE RISK OF OCCUPANT INJURY IN THE EVENT OF A CRASH. THE LETTER FURTHER STATES THAT PARTS ARE NOT CURRENTLY AVAILABLE. A RECENT CALL TO THE PONTIAC CUSTOMER ASSISTANCE CENTER CONFIRMED THAT THE PARTS ARE STILL NOT AVAILABLE TO REPAIR THIS VEHICLE. DUE TO THIS POTENTIAL HAZARD I HAVE NOT HAD ANYONE SIT IN THE PASSENGER SIDE OF MY VEHICLE SINCE THE SAFELY RECALL LETTER WAS SENT TO ME ALMOST NINE MONTHS AGO. IN FACT THERE WAS ALREADY ONE OTHER SAFETY RECALL ON THIS SAME AIRBAG SOME TIME AGO THAT I HAD REPLACED AT MY LOCAL GM DEALER IN KINGMAN, AZ. I AM REPORTING THIS TO YOU BECAUSE I FEEL THAT WAY TOO MUCH TIME HAS GONE BY WITHOUT ANY PART REPLACEMENT AVAILABLE FOR THIS AIRBAG .SINCE THIS DEFECT COULD INCREASE THE RISK OF OCCUPANT INJURY IN THE EVENT OF A CRASH, I FEEL THAT THIS COMPANY HAS BEEN UNDULY NEGLIGENT IN NOT PROVIDING A REPLACEMENT PART SINCE THE SAFETY RECALL NOTICE WAS SENT TO ME IN OCTOBER 2019. CAN ANYTHING BE DONE ABOUT THIS? THE GM SAFETY RECALL # IS N192273760.

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2008 PONTIAC VIBE. THE CONTACT RECEIVED NOTIFICATION OF NHTSA CAMPAIGN NUMBER: 19V627000 (AIRBAG) HOWEVER, THE PART TO DO THE RECALL REPAIR WAS UNAVAILABLE.  THE CONTACT CALLED THE DEALER KINGMAN CHEVROLET BUICK  (ADDRESS: 3730 STOCKTON HILL RD, KINGMAN, AZ 86409; PHONE: (928) 757-4041) WHERE IT WAS CONFIRMED THAT THE PART WAS NOT AVAILABLE. THE CONTACT STATED THAT THE MANUFACTURER EXCEEDED A REASONABLE AMOUNT OF TIME FOR THE RECALL REPAIR.  THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOT MADE AWARE OF THE ISSUE. THE CONTACT HAD NOT EXPERIENCED A FAILURE. VIN TOOL CONFIRMS PARTS NOT AVAILABLE.

THE CONTACT STATED THAT THE MANUFACTURER EXCEEDED A REASONABLE AMOUNT OF TIME FOR THE RECALL REPAIR.  THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOT MADE AWARE OF THE ISSUE. THE CONTACT HAD NOT EXPERIENCED A FAILURE. VIN TOOL CONFIRMS PARTS NOT AVAILABLE.

I CONTACTED GM ABOUT THE RECALL AND THEY TOLD ME THAT THEY DON'T HAVE THE PART YET AND WHEN THE GET THE PART IN THEY WOULD CONTACT ME TO REPLACE IT BUT THAT WAS IN 2019 AND NEVER HERD FROM THEM THIS VERY DAY.  *TR

RECEIVED LETTER FROM PONTIAC DATED OCT 2019 THAT FRONT PASSENGER AIRBAG IS DEFECTIVE AND MIGHT NOT INFLATE AND COULD INJURE PERSON IN A CAR CRASH.  REPAIR PARTS WERE NOT READY IN OCT 2019.      IT IS NOW SEVEN MONTHS LATER.  ARE THE PARTS STILL NOT READY?  WHEN WILL THEY BE READY?    NOTHING HAS HAPPENED YET, BUT THIS IS WORRISOME.      I RECEIVED THE LETTER 10/21/2019.  THE DEALER HAS NO REPAIR PARTS.  IT IS SEVEN MONTHS LATER.  *TR

TAKATA RECALL:  MY PONTIAC VIBE IS PART OF THE AIRBAG RECALL THROUGH GM. MY FIRST APPOINTMENT WITH KING O'ROURKE IN SMITHTOWN, NY, WAS JULY 28, 2016. AFTER WAITING 90 MINUTES, I WAS TOLD THEY DID NOT HAVE THE RIGHT PART. I DO NOT KNOW WHY THEY DID NOT KNOW THIS WHEN THEY MADE THE APPOINTMENT OR WHEN I CHECKED IN (THE KING O'ROURKE CHECK-IN PROCESS CAN TAKE UP TO 20 MINUTES).  THEY SAID THEY WOULD ORDER THE PART AND CALL ME WHEN IT WAS AVAILABLE. THEY NEVER CALLED ME. I CALLED THEM IN EARLY NOVEMBER 2016 AND THEY SAID THEY HAD THE PART AND SET UP AN APPOINTMENT FOR NOV. 30, 2016.  I ARRIVED AT 7:45 A.M. AND WENT THROUGH CHECK-IN AND WAS TOLD AT 8:45 THAT THEY DID NOT HAVE THE PART. AGAIN, I DON'T KNOW WHY THEY WOULD NOT KNOW THIS WHEN THEY MADE THE APPOINTMENT OR WHEN I FIRST CHECKED IN.  SO THE LATET PLAN IS THEY SAY THEY HAVE TO REORDER THE PROPER PART AND THEY WILL CONTACT ME WHEN IT ARRIVES.  I HAVE NOT HAD ANY PROBLEMS WITH MY AIRBAGS. JUST A BIG PROBLEM GETTING THE RECALL COMPLETED WITH KING O'ROURKE.
POWER STEERING WOULD RANDOMLY QUIT WHILE DRIVING.  NEEDED TO REPLACE POWER STEERING CONTROL MODULE.

THE DEALER DID NOT GIVE A SPECIFIC DATE FOR WHEN THE PART WOULD BECOME AVAILABLE. THE MANUFACTURER COULD NOT PROVIDE AN ESTIMATED DATE FOR WHEN THE CONTACT'S VEHICLE WOULD RECEIVE THE RECALL REPAIR. WE CALLED THEM TODAY AND TOLD US PARTS WERE ON BACK ORDER. SOME ONE NEEDS TO CLEAR THIS UP. WE WILL BE LEAVING THE AREA IN ABOUT 6 WEEKS. WHY THE LETTER IF YOU DON'T HAVE THE PARTS?

TAKATA RECALL - GM REPEATEDLY FAILING TO RESPOND OR COMMIT TO REPAIR RECALLED VEHICLE. RECEIVED LETTER ABOUT RECALL 15815 LAST WEEK. REPRESENTATIVE AT PONTIAC (REF #[XXX], 4/21/16) CONFIRMED THAT THE VEHICLE, WHICH IS MY PRIMARY SOURCE OF INCOME (STUDENT AND RIDESHARE DRIVER) IS UNDER RECALL AND THAT NO ONE SHOULD OCCUPY PASSENGER SEATS UNTIL REPAIR IS MADE. MANUFACTURER IS UNABLE TO PROVIDE EVEN AN ESTIMATE OF DATE FOR PARTS AVAILABILITY AND CURRENTLY HAS LOWEST COMPLETION OF REPAIRS ACCORDING TO NHTSA. I HAVE CONTACTED THE DEALER (CHAPMAN CHEVROLET, TEMPE, AZ) IN PERSON, WAS TOLD BY SERVICE CONSULTANT [XXX] TO CONTACT [XXX] PARENT FOR RECALL SCHEDULING, BUT THAT SHE WAS OUT OF THE OFFICE AT THAT TIME. I CONTACTED [XXX] BY PHONE AND LEFT MESSAGES WHICH WERE NOT RETURNED ON TWO CONSECUTIVE DAYS. I WENT TO DEALERSHIP AND MADE CONTACT WITH HER IN PERSON ON 4/22/16. I WAS BROUGHT BACK TO HER OFFICE, WHERE HER COWORKERS WERE JUST BROWSING HUFFINGTON POST ARTICLES. SHE AGREED DEALERSHIP WOULD CALL ON MONDAY 4/25/16 TO PROVIDE AN UPDATE AFTER SPEAKING WITH AREA GM REP "[XXX]" TO SEE IF A LOANER OR DEALER PURCHASE OF THE VEHICLE WERE POSSIBLE. AS OF THE END OF WORK 4/25/16 [XXX] HAS AGAIN NOT RETURNED THE CALL. I ATTEMPTED TO CONTACT HER ONCE AGAIN AND LEFT A MESSAGE. I HAVE LOST CONFIDENCE THAT GM IS TAKING CARE OF THEIR CONSUMERS IN THIS RECALL. WHILE THEY STALL AND FAIL TO PROVIDE TIMELY REPAIR OR RESPONSE, I AM LEFT WITH AN UNSAFE CAR, NO INCOME, AND NO COMMITMENT THAT EITHER WILL CHANGE. I AM UNWILLING TO SELL THE CAR TO ANOTHER PRIVATE PARTY WHO WOULD BE ENDANGERED BY THE UNREPAIRED CAR. PLEASE HELP - THANK YOU!!    INFORMATION REDACTED PURSUANT TO THE FREEDOM OF INFORMATION ACT (FOIA), 5 U.S.C. 552(B)(6).  *TR

TAKATA RECALL. I RECEIVED A RECALL FOR MY AIRBAG. NEITHER THE DEALER OR GM CAN EVEN GIVE ME AN ESTIMATE AS TO WHEN REPAIR PARTS WILL BE RECEIVED. ON TOP OF THAT, THE RECALL STATES THAT ""UNTIL THE REPAIR IS PERFORMED, THE FRONT PASSENGER SEAT SHOULD NOT BE OCCUPIED ". I REGULARLY USE THIS VEHICLE TO CARPOOL WITH FOUR ADULTS. THIS RENDERS MY CAR AS UNUSABLE! NEITHER THE DEALER OR GM HAD EVEN A TEMPORARY SOLUTION. I AM AT A LOSS AS WHAT TO DO NEXT.

TAKATA RECALL - I RECEIVED A RECALL NOTICE FROM PONTIAC.  WHEN I CONTACTED THEM ABOUT THE RECALL I WAS TOLD THEY HAD NO IDEA WHEN PARTS WOULD BE AVAILABLE TO FIX IT AND THAT UNTIL THE REPAIR IS PERFORMED, THE FRONT PASSENGER SEAT SHOULD NOT BE OCCUPIED.  THIS IS IMPOSSIBLE GIVEN THE SIZE OF MY FAMILY NOT TO USE THE FRONT PASSENGER SEAT.  WHEN I ASKED ABOUT A RESOLUTION TO THIS SITUATION THEY SAID IT WAS NOT THEIR PROBLEM AND REFUSED TO DIRECT MY CONCERN TO A SUPERVISOR OR MANAGER.  I REQUESTED THE EMAIL ADDRESS OF THE VP OF GLOBAL VEHICLE SAFETY ([XXX] ) WHO SENT ME THE LETTER AND THEY INFORMED ME THAT IT WAS NOT AVAILABLE.  SO GM IS TELLING ME THAT I CAN'T SAFELY USE THE CAR FOR WHAT I PURCHASED FOR.  THIS IS UNACCEPTABLE AND I WANT TO KNOW WHAT RECOURSE I HAVE IN THIS SITUATION. ONE MILE INTO COMMUTE, THE ACCELERATOR PEDAL DIDN'T RESPOND AFTER STOPPING, THEN SUDDENLY RESPONDED CAUSING CAR TO ACCELERATE RAPIDLY. REPEATED TWICE BEFORE THE CHECK ENGINE LIGHT CAME ON. STOPPED CAR, SHUT THE CAR OFF, CHECKED GAS CAP WAS FASTENED SECURELY. RESTARTED CAR. THE CHECK ENGINE LIGHT REMAINED ILLUMINATED. TURNED AROUND AND PROCEEDED THE ONE MILE HOME. COASTED INTO THE PARKING GARAGE AND STOPPED THE CAR TO WAIT FOR THE GARAGE DOOR TO CLOSE. WHILE COMPLETELY STOPPED THE CAR TRIED TO ACCELERATE WITHOUT ANY INPUT TO THE GAS PEDAL. THE RPM'S INCREASED AND THE CAR TRIED TO DRIVE FORWARD. THE RPM'S DIDN'T DECREASE UNTIL THE CAR WAS PLACED IN NEUTRAL. THE SUDDEN RPM INCREASE WHILE STOPPED CAUSED THE TIRES TO SQUEAL AGAINST THE SMOOTH PAVEMENT IN THE PARKING GARAGE. SHUT THE CAR OFF, PLACED IN PARK, RESTARTED THE CAR AND PULLED INTO MY PARKING SPOT. THE NEXT DAY STARTED THE CAR AND THE CHECK ENGINE LIGHT WAS STILL ILLUMINATED. DROVE THE CAR APPROXIMATELY 5 MILES TO THE DEALER WITHOUT INCIDENT.  DEALER INITIALLY REFUSED TO PROVIDE A COPY OF THE ORDER AND AFTER INSISTING ON HAVING A COPY THE SERVICE MANAGER NEGLECTED TO INDICATE ON THE WORK ORDER THAT THE CAR SUDDENLY ACCELERATED WITHOUT INPUT TO THE ACCELERATOR PEDAL. DEALER REFUSED TO COVER THE COST OF REPLACING THE ACCELERATOR PEDAL POSITION SENSOR UNDER WARRANTY AND ARGUED THAT THE SUDDEN ACCELERATION WITHOUT INPUT OR RANDOM INCREASED RPM VIOLATES THE 8/80K EPA WARRANTY OR MODERN SAFETY STANDARDS.  CONTACTED GM WARRANTY WHO ALSO REFUSED TO COVER THE REPLACEMENT COST UNDER EPA OR SAFETY WARRANTY.  *TR

TL*  THE CONTACT OWNS A 2008 PONTIAC VIBE. THE CONTACT WAS DRIVING APPROXIMATELY 65 MPH, AND SUDDENLY THERE WAS A REDUCTION IN THE ENGINE POWER. WHEN AT A COMPLETE STOP THE ENGINE WOULD STALL WHILE THE WARNING INDICATOR ILLUMINATED ON THE INSTRUMENT PANEL AND WITHIN A FEW MINUTES THE ENGINE WOULD RESTART. NHTSA RECALL CAMPAIGN ID NUMBER 10V387000 (ENGINE AND ENGINE COOLING) WAS RELATED TO THE FAILURE.  THE VEHICLE WAS TAKEN TO AN AUTHORIZED DEALER WHERE THEY STATED THE PART DID NOT REQUIRE REPLACEMENT AND REFUSED TO REPAIR THE VEHICLE, EVEN THOUGH THE CONTACT EXPERIENCED THE CONSEQUENCE MENTIONED IN THE RECALL. THE CONTACT WILL NOTIFY THE MANUFACTURER OF THE DEFECT. THE APPROXIMATE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 30,000.

MY 3 YEAR OLD SON RIDES IN A CARSEAT THAT IS INSTALLED USING THE LATCH SYSTEM, 2 DAYS AGO HE GOT THE CAR'S SEATBELT AND MANAGED TO GET IT WRAPPED AROUND HIS NECK WHEN HE LET GO OF THE SEATBELT THE SEATBELT  LOCKED. WHEN I REALIZED WHAT HAD HAPPENED I WAS ABLE TO PULL OVER AND AFTER ATTEMPTING TO GET THE SEATBELT TO UNLOCK WITHOUT ANY SUCCESS THE SEATBELT HAD TO BE CUT TO GET IT FROM AROUND HIS NECK. FEB 3, 2011 WAS THE FIRST OCCURRENCE.  I PUT THE CAR IN REVERSE THEN PULLED FORWARD, TURNING THE WHEEL TO THE RIGHT TO GIVE MYSELF ROOM TO BACK UP AND TURN MY CAR SO I COULD PULL OUT ONTO A BUSY STREET GOING FORWARD RATHER THAN BACKING OUT INTO TRAFFIC.  I WAS GOING VERY SLOWLY AND APPLIED THE BRAKES WHEN THE CAR SUDDENLY ACCELERATED VERY FAST.  IT RAN UP AN 18" ROCK WALL, PUSHING THE BRAKE DID NOTHING, I TURNED THE WHEEL TO THE RIGHT TO AVOID A TREE WHILE STILL TRYING TO BRAKE.  THE BRAKE FINALLY HELD.  A TIRE WAS DESTROYED, IT WAS REPLACED AND TAKEN TO MY MECHANIC WHO FOUND NO FURTHER DAMAGE AND NO REASON FOR THE ACCELERATION.  AFTER LEAVING THE MECHANIC I NOTICED THAT IT SEEMED A BIT JERKY.  TWO DAYS LATER I TURNED THE CAR ON WHILE SITTING IN A PARKING LOT WITH MY FOOT ON THE BRAKE, I WAS STILL IN PARK SO THE CAR DID NOT MOVE, BUT IT DID ACCELERATE.  IT SEEMED OK AFTER THAT, MONDAY WHEN I RETURNED TO TOWN I DISCUSSED IT WITH MY MECHANIC AND NOTICED A REPORT ON BLOOMBERG ABOUT THE ISSUE WITH TOYOTA ACCELERATION PROBLEMS AND THAT THE PROBLEM WAS ALSO WITH 2009 AND 2010 PONTIAC VIBES..  I CHECKED THIS SITE AND FOUND 2 COMPLAINTS ABOUT MY SAME ISSUE WITH THE 2008 PONTIAC VIBE. *TR

TL*THE CONTACT OWNS A 2008 PONTIAC VIBE.  WHILE DRIVING 50 MPH, THE CONTACT WAS INVOLVED IN A HEAD ON CRASH WITH A SEMI TRUCK.  THE AIR BAGS FAILED TO DEPLOY.  PRIOR TO THE CRASH, THE VEHICLE WAS TAKEN TO THE DEALER ON FOUR OCCASIONS REGARDING THE ABS.  WHEN THE VEHICLE WAS RETRIEVED, THE CONTACT HEARD A SQUEAKY NOISE AND TOOK THE VEHICLE BACK TO THE DEALER.  NEW BRAKES PADS WERE PLACED ON THE VEHICLE AT THAT TIME.  AFTER THE CRASH, THE VEHICLE WAS TOWED AND TAKEN IN FOR A DIAGNOSTIC.  A POLICE REPORT WAS FILED.  THE CONTACT SUSTAINED MAJOR INJURIES TO THE KNEES AND HEAD, INCLUDING A BROKEN WRIST AND BACK PAINS.  THE FAILURE AND CURRENT MILEAGES WERE 50,000.

TL*THE CONTACT OWNS A 2008 PONTIAC VIBE.  ON APRIL 22, 2008, WHILE DRIVING 35 MPH, THE CONTACT'S VEHICLE WAS STRUCK ON THE FRONT PASSENGER DOOR BY ANOTHER VEHICLE.  THE DRIVER'S SIDE SEAT BELT FAILED TO RESTRAIN THE CONTACT, CAUSING HER TO STRIKE AND INJURE HER HEAD AGAINST THE DASHBOARD.  THE PASSENGER RECEIVED INJURIES TO HER LEGS.  THE INSURANCE COMPANY INVESTIGATION DISCOVERED THAT THE DRIVER'S SIDE SEAT BELT BOLT FAILED, WHICH CAUSED THE SEAT BELT TO FAIL.  THE INSURANCE COMPANY DECLARED THE VEHICLE TO BE DESTROYED.  THE FRONT DRIVER AND PASSENGER SIDE AIR BAGS FAILED TO DEPLOY.  THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 2,000.

WE RENTED A 2008 PONTIAC VIBE ON 2-9-08 FROM THE FT. LAUDERDALE AIRPORT AND WE WERE DRIVING ABOUT 115 MILES TO ISLAMORADA FL.  ABOUT 1 MILE FROM OUR DESTINATION WE HEARD A TREMENDOUS NOISE FROM THE BACK SEAT AREA THAT SOUNDED LIKE AN EXPLOSION.  WE NOTICED THAT THE WINDOW IN THE BACK HAD SHATTERED.  WE HAD NO IDEA WHY IT HAD SHATTERED.  SINCE THAT TIME WE HAVE READ NEWS ACCOUNTS ABOUT CERTAIN PONTIAC VIBES EXPERIENCING SPONTANEOUS SHATTERING OF PASSENGER DOOR WINDOWS.  JUST WANTED TO PASS THIS ALONG IN THE NAME OF SAFETY.  *TR

DESCRIPTION OF MALFUNCTION: ENGINE ACCELERATED WHEN BRAKE WAS APPLIED.    THIS CONDITION OCCURRED ONCE, BUT COULD HAVE CAUSE AN ACCIDENT.  ON SATURDAY 3/29/08 (NO RAIN; TEMP 35 DEG F) , I WAS DRIVING ON A WINDING RURAL ROAD AND GOING AROUND 30 MPH. THE CRUISE CONTROL WAS OFF.  I STARTED BRAKING SINCE I WAS GOING DOWN A SLIGHT GRADE AND GETTING CLOSE TO A RED TRAFFIC LIGHT.  SUDDENLY THE CAR STARTED SPEEDING UP, EVEN WITH MY FOOT ON THE BRAKE.  I NOTICED THAT THE IDLE WAS AROUND 3,000 RPM.  I MANUALLY THREW THE AUTOMATIC GEAR SHIFT INTO NEUTRAL AND THE CAR STARTED RACING TO AROUND 4500 RPM.  I STOPPED THE VEHICLE, TURNED OFF THE KEY, PUT THE CAR INTO PARK, AND APPLIED THE PARKING BRAKE.  I PUT MY 4 WAYS ON AND CHECKED UNDER THE HOOD.  OF COURSE, EVERYTHING LOOKED IN ORDER AND I COULD NOT LOCATE THE THROTTLE.  I SHUT THE HOOD AND GOT BACK INTO THE CAR.  I PUSHED THE ACCELERATOR PEDAL THREE TIMES DOWN TO THE FLOOR.  I WAITED A MINUTE AND THEN STARTED THE CAR.  THE IDLE WAS BACK TO NORMAL AND THE CAR RAN NORMAL.      I TOOK IT TO THE DEALER TO GET CHECKED OUT ON WEDNESDAY 4/2/08.  NO TROUBLE FOUND.     NO OTHER OCCURRENCES OF THIS NATURE TO REPORT.  THIS CONDITION IS EXTREMELY UNSAFE; NEEDS TO BE CORRECTED ASAP.  MY VIBE ONLY HAS 3,000 MILES AND WAS PURCHASED NEW FROM A DEALER IN DECEMBER, 2007.    BASED UPON YOUR SITE'S COMPLAINTS THAT I HAVE REVIEWED, THERE ARE OTHER PONTIAC VIBES, TOYOTA MATRIXS AND TOYOTA COROLLAS THAT HAVE EXPERIENCED THIS CONDITION.  FORTUNATELY THERE AREN'T THAT MANY THAT HAVE REPORTED THIS CONDITION, THERE ARE ENOUGH THAT SUPPORT THE FACT THAT SOMETHING IS WRONG AND NEEDS TO BE FIXED BEFORE SOMEONE GETS HURT. I UNDERSTAND THAT THESE MODELS DO NOT  HAVE A CABLE THAT CONNECTS THE GAS PEDAL TO THE THROTTLE.  THESE CARS HAVE AN ELECTRONIC THROTTLE.  THERE APPEARS TO BE AN ELECTRICAL MALFUNCTION THAT IS OCCURRING. THERE MUST BE A COMPUTER MALFUNCTION, WIRING CONNECTOR PROBLEM, A SENSOR OR THROTTLE ACTUATOR THAT IS MALFUNCTIONING.   *TR
